The College of Communication (COM) at Boston University was initially founded in 1947 as the School of Public Relations. The College of Communication is the oldest public relations school in the United States. The school offers degrees in three different departments: Film and Television; Journalism; and Mass Communication (Advertising, Public Relations, and Communication Studies). The College of Communication building is built from blocks from Kenmore Square and Fenway Park.
Com at a Glance:
- Undergraduate students: 2,000 - Postgraduate students: 400 - Home to many of the student-run organizations ,including BUTV and WTBU Radio - Special internship programs in Los Angeles, Washington D.C. and London - Film program ranked 11th by The Hollywood Reporter in 2013
